body.p: To his Excellency Thos E. Bramlette Esq. Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky:

Your petitioner Henry H. Murray of the County of Franklin would respectfully represent to your Excellency that at the Feby. term 1864 of the Franklin Circuit Court a judgment was rendered against him on forfeited recognizance as security for E. Noble for twenty five Dollars as will appear from the inclosed transcript of said Judgment. Now your petitioner would respectfully ask the interference of Executive Clemency upon the ground that during the pendency of said case, the said Noble lost his wife by sickness and that consequently he could not make his appearance at court wherefore Judgment went against him; and also that he is now totally insolvent. And we whose names are hereunto attached would respectfully ask your Excellency to remit said fine.

Thos. C. Kyle
David Staples
Richd Sharpe
Jno B Tilford Jr.
J H Graham
Chas J. Clarke
Wm. E. Cox
Chas. Hayden
Frank H Pope
J R Watson
